main_definition: Buses refers to vehicles designed for public transportation of passengers, as well as an idiomatic expression meaning various things in different contexts.

meanings_and_examples.example: She took the bus to work every morning.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A large group of people or objects moving together in a coordinated manner
meanings_and_examples.example: The troops moved like a swarm, similar to buses lining up and proceeding as one unit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To move something along a path steadily and continuously
meanings_and_examples.example: I'll walk my dog around the block, making sure he gets plenty of exercise. I'll keep him on a leash so we don't disturb others; it's like controlling them like buses.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A metaphorical expression to describe things coming in large quantities or moving together
meanings_and_examples.example: After the storm, leaves were falling like buses from the trees.
